function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of studies on China and its built environment attributes may lead to misunderstanding of the local factors influencing disease spread in the region.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of regional disease spread and ineffective mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Conducting specific studies on China and its built environment attributes to understand local factors influencing disease spread, and develop targeted mitigation strategies.","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, data visualization platforms.","People":"Public health researchers, policy makers, urban planners.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, government agencies."},{"Description":"Assumption of spatial homogeneity of built environment attributes may result in overlooking localized factors influencing disease spread, leading to ineffective mitigation strategies.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of localized disease spread and ineffective mitigation strategies for specific areas.","Mitigation":"Use of mixed Geographically Weighted Regression (GWR) model to estimate global and local effects of built environment attributes, and careful analysis of spatial clusters of the disease spread.","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, regression modeling software.","People":"Public health researchers, data scientists, spatial analysts.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Limited data on built environment attributes in some cities may lead to incomplete understanding of the factors influencing disease spread in those areas.","Impact":"Incomplete assessment of disease spread and risk factors in areas with limited data, leading to inadequate mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Improving data collection and accessibility of built environment attributes in all cities, and conducting targeted studies to fill data gaps.","Technologies":"Data collection and aggregation tools, geospatial databases.","People":"Data scientists, urban planners, public health researchers.","Owner":"Government agencies, research institutions, data collection organizations."}]}
